result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deante Jamar Clayton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deante Jamar Clayton appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Deante Jamar Clayton.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case in court with 22CM2133. Defense requests a status conference date. Court addresses Justice Point missed office contacts. With no objection from the State, Court modifies Justice Point monitoring to level 2. Case adjourned, Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
See hearing event from 9/21/2022 for court record entry.

Defendant Deante Jamar Clayton appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Deante Jamar Clayton.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant CANCELLED. Original Complaint filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court sets $500 signature bond with LEVEL 3 Justice Point Supervision. 

Court appoints Michael B Plaisted as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Plaisted accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 12/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 

Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deante Jamar Clayton not in court. Student Intern Madeline Witter under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/9/22 @ 1p
